content:
United Airlines offers two economy-class fare options: Basic Economy and Economy. The main differences between them are:

**Basic Economy:**

* Lower fare, but with more restrictions
* No checked bags (carry-on only, and it must fit in the overhead bin)
* No seat selection (seat assigned at check-in)
* Boarding group 5 (last to board)
* No upgrades or changes allowed
* Earns 50% Premier Qualifying Miles (PQMs) and 50% Lifetime Miles

**Economy:**

* Higher fare, but with more flexibility
* One free checked bag (plus a carry-on)
* Seat selection available at booking (including aisle seats)
* Boarding group 3 or 4 (depending on the flight)
* Changes and upgrades allowed (subject to availability and fees)
* Earns 100% Premier Qualifying Miles (PQMs) and 100% Lifetime Miles

Whether the extra $40 is worth it depends on your personal preferences and travel habits:

* If you're a light traveler who only brings a carry-on and doesn't mind not choosing your seat, Basic Economy might be a good option.
* If you need to check a bag, prefer to choose your seat (like an aisle seat), or want more flexibility with your ticket, Economy might be worth the extra cost.
* If you're a frequent flyer or trying to earn elite status, the extra PQMs and Lifetime Miles in Economy might be valuable to you.

In your case, since you mentioned you prefer an aisle seat, Economy might be the better option. Additionally, if you plan to check a bag or want more flexibility with your ticket, the extra $40 might be worth it.

Do you want to stick with Basic Economy or upgrade to Economy?
